required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dual Target CAR-T Cells in B-cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial of CD19/CD20 Dual Target CAR-T Cells in the Treatment of Relapsed/Refractory B-cell Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: Prospectively evaluate the safety and effectiveness of CD19/CD20 dual-target CAR-T cells in the treatment of relapsed/refractory B-cell lymphoma .

detailed_description.textblock: Prospectively evaluate the safety and effectiveness of CD19/CD20 dual-target CAR-T cells in the treatment of relapsed/refractory B-cell lymphoma . Strictly follow the inclusion criteria to screen eligible subjects for inclusion in clinical trials. The selected patients received CD19/CD20 dual-target CAR-T cell therapy. After the treatment is over, follow-up regularly to determine the survival status and follow-up treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of initial treatment to the end of follow up, up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: All visible lesions disappeared completely and maintained at least 4 weeks.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From admission to the end of follow up, up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of surviving patients at the end of the study.

intervention.description: CD19/CD20 dual target CAR-T cell therapy
